name: Quid
slogan: Turn text into context with Quid's one-of-a-kind analytic software
description: Quid builds software that augments human intelligence. We’re defining a new market and pioneering technology that helps strategic thinkers make decisions in a fraction of the time. Quid algorithms reveal patterns in large, unstructured datasets and then generate beautiful, actionable visualizations.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Bob Goodson
team.bioHtml: Founder @Quid • Worked at @Yelp • Studied at @University of Oxford

team.title: Head of Diversity & Inclusion
team.name: Meena Iyer
team.bioHtml:
Enterprise Services Manager and Head of Diversity & Inclusion at a high-growth NLP/AI startup; 
healthcare consulting; Emory University Grad

jobs.title: Manager, Consulting Services, Japanese Speaker
jobs.description:
Managers are the pillars of our consulting teams and you should expect to be an immediate contributor on strategic projects conducted for our clients. You’ll work directly with clients and take ownership of either multiple project work streams or entire projects and end Deliverables, either independently or with a team of analysts. You will establish trust-based relationships, serve senior executives with critical insights, identify account development opportunities, and support the creation of proposals to implement Quid into the client’s strategic process.

**The Opportunity**

- Lead consulting projects for Quid clients (primary focus on Industrial verticals, and the Japanese market)
- Build and maintain a trusted relationship with our clients
- Develop new ways for clients to leverage Quid to solve strategic questions
- Strategically identify potential service opportunities within our client base and beyond
- Work closely with sales teams and directors to identify and/or develop up-sell Opportunities
- Lead a team of analysts to support workflows
- Advocate client needs/issues to the product and engineering team to build an exceptional product
- Opportunity to work on site at any of NetbaseQuid offices or remotely within APAC / US time zone

**Qualifications**

- 4-6 years of experience in strategic consulting, private equity, investment banking, or similarly analytical roles
- Bachelor's degree or its equivalent in Business, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field is required
- Must be proficient in Japanese language
- Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and concise manner
- Strong problem solving abilities
- Expert knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint, and willing to learn new tools quickly
- The power to take initiative, communicate across teams, and solve problems creatively, both in teams and individually

Please note before submitting your application: As a company, we take hiring very seriously.  Interviewing with Quid may include video and phone interviews, written projects, and/or onsite interviews. Although we are unable to follow-up with each and every applicant, we do our best to run a thorough process with whom we identify a potential fit.

jobs.title: Business Operations Specialist
jobs.description:
**_Position Overview:_**

The Business Operations Specialist is a critical member of our growing Company responsible for providing best-in industry support for order processing to our customers and sales team. The Business Operations Specialist will have several responsibilities that will include reviewing contracts, generating and processing sales orders, reviewing pricing, and handling customer order related inquiries.  Contract administration for two entities, NetBase Solutions, Inc and Quid, LLC.  Provisioning product, data and trials as well as participation in company integration. The Business Operations Specialist has a high sense of ownership and engages across several internal functions with management and the sales field.  This position is also actively involved in the Company’s month and year end booking, Invoicing backlog reports, and closing processes. 

**_Principal Duties and Responsibilities (Essential Functions**)_**:

- _Order Fulfillment_
  - Accurately generates and processes sales orders on a timely basis, working closely with sales team, management, customers and partners.
  - Reviews and ensures approvals are in place for all orders before entering information into applicable systems, ensuring that documents are in compliance with established internal guidelines.
  - Work with the legal department on negotiated contracts terms of use for both NetBase and Quid, and ensuring our companies are in compliance with third parties.
  - Prepare and maintain summary of significant contract terms including renewal dates, and management of contracts/amendments.
  - Ensures accurate information, pricing and other requirements in accordance with discounting, gross margin limits and revenue recognition guidelines.
  - Review customer contracts with Corporate Controller/CFO for revenue recognition reporting for contracts with special requirements.
  - Responsible for customer communication regarding contract questions, foreign documents and other related issues.
  - Tracks orders through entire order entry process, ensuring orders are fulfilled when purchased, and service is terminated when customer discontinues payment of service.
  - Works with Account Management and Customer Success on initiating and ending access to SaaS subscription accounts.
  - Responsible for maintaining customer contract files, for all NetBase and Quid contracts for central access, legal and audit purposes.
  - Proactively seeks to improve new processes, product knowledge and business practices.
  - Works in applicable systems to ensure data integrity between all systems.
  - Provisioning customer – contracts, data and trial requests.
  - Assists in developing procedures, improving systems, and other activities that help build operational capabilities and improve the customer experience to extend our competitive advantage.
  - Assist Revenue Manager with monthly revenue analysis if necessary.

**_Qualifications & Skills:_**

- Bachelors of Science (BS) degree in accounting or business related.
- Minimum 3-4 years related experience.
- Self-motivated with a strong work ethic and works independently with high standards for quality.
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both spoken and written with a customer service focus.
- Must be a quick learner, highly organized with good analytical skills and a keen eye for detail.
- Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, work independently, and excel with minimal supervision
- Ability to prioritize effectively and manage deadlines in a high-pressure environment.
- Team player who can effectively work with external customers, as well cross-functionally throughout the organization in order to align goals and objectives.
- Proficient in Microsoft Office, with a heavy emphasis on Excel reports and pivot tables.

Experienced working with Salesforce

jobs.title: Analyst, Consulting Services, Japanese Speaker
jobs.description:
Analyst are a key part of our consulting teams and you should expect to be an immediate contributor on strategic projects conducted for our clients. You’ll work directly with major Japanese clients and take ownership of either multiple project work streams or entire projects and end-deliverables, either independently, with other analysts, or with Managers from the team. You will establish trust-based relationships, serve senior executives with critical insights, identify account development opportunities, and support the creation of proposals to implement NetbaseQuid into the client’s strategic process.

**The Opportunity**

- Lead consulting projects for NetbaseQuid clients (primary focus on Industrial verticals, and the Japanese market)
- Build and maintain a trusted relationship with our clients
- Develop new ways for clients to leverage on NetbaseQuid to solve strategic questions
- Strategically identify potential service opportunities within our client base and beyond
- Work closely with sales teams and directors to identify and/or develop up-sell

Opportunities

- Support training opportunities
- Advocate client needs/issues to the product and engineering team to build an exceptional product
- Opportunity to work on site at any of NetbaseQuid offices or remotely within APAC / US time zone

**Qualifications**

- Must be proficient in Japanese language
- 1-4 years of experience in strategic consulting, private equity, investment banking, or similarly analytical roles
- Bachelor's degree or its equivalent in Business, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field is required
- Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and concise manner
- Strong problem solving abilities
- Expert knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint, and willing to learn new tools quickly
- The power to take initiative, communicate across teams, and solve problems creatively, both in teams and individually

Please note before submitting your application: As a company, we take hiring very seriously.  Interviewing with Quid may include video and phone interviews, written projects, and/or onsite interviews. Although we are unable to follow-up with each and every applicant, we do our best to run a thorough process with whom we identify a potential fit.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
**Senior DevOps Engineer**

As a Senior DevOps engineer for  the Quid product you will build software and processes to enable engineers to self-service the operation of NetBase Quid at scale and support 24x7 operations. Our developers are your customers. 

Your goal is to continuously assess and ease pain points of fellow engineers and of our Cloud infrastructure. We strive to allow developers to take an idea from their laptops through to production in the quickest yet safest way possible. In this role you will work on a wide range of problems and be exposed to many different technologies. 

**The Opportunity**  

- Automate and document everything 
- Build software, tools, and processes to allow our engineers to move fast without incident (e.g. deployment, containers, monitoring) 
- Identify deficient technology in our Cloud infrastructure and find or write superior alternatives (e.g. security, orchestration, disaster recovery) 
- Reduce firing up and provisioning clusters of servers and services to a single button press 
- Hardening our security across the company to handle very sensitive data 
- Establish and evangelize best development and security practices 
- Distribute and support sane development environments with tools like Docker / Kubernetes 
- Collaborate with product developers to solve complex problems under development or in production 
- Conduct periodic on-call duties using a follow-the-sun model. 

**Your Qualifications**  

- 5-8+ years building professional grade DevOps Tools 
- Thorough comfort with at least one programming language and experience with several 
- Experience with at least one automated provisioning system ( Terraform, Ansible) 
- Experience with CI/CD pipeline (Jenkins, Bitbucket, Nexus) 
- Experience with Kubernetes and Helm Charts  
- Experience with containers (Docker) and virtual machines 
- Competency in a Linux environment 
- Strong interest in an inward-facing (rather than product oriented) position 
- Familiarity with many of the technologies behind modern day distributed web and data applications 
- Nice to have: Security hardening experience 
- Nice to have: Diverse project history ranging from very systems-oriented to very customer-facing
